What is Clash of Clans

Clash of Clans is a popular mobile strategy game developed by Supercell, released in 2012. It’s a free-to-play game with in-app purchases, and it has remained one of the most played mobile games for over a decade. The game is all about building a village, training troops, attacking other players, and defending your base.

Clash of Clans is a mix of base-building, resource management, and real-time strategy. Players manage their home village and upgrade buildings, defenses walls and make their base more strong.

You can place defensive structures like Cannons, Archer Towers, X-Bows, Inferno Towers, and Eagle Artillery to stop enemy attacks. Walls play a crucial role in slowing down enemy troops. A strong base layout is essential for protecting your loot.

You train troops in Barracks, Dark Barracks, and Siege Workshops to raid enemy bases. Troops include Barbarians, Archers, Wizards, Dragons, P.E.K.K.A, Balloons, and more. Players choose attack strategies based on the enemy base layout. Spells like Healing, Rage, and Freeze help in battles.

 Types of Bases

Farming Base (For Protecting Resources)

The purpose of a Farming Base is to protect Gold, Elixir, and Dark Elixir by ignoring the trophies. Bases are designed with a specific strategy. Resources are spread out across the base and make it harder for the attackers to loot the resources. The Dark Elixir storage is placed in the center since it is the most valuable and hardest-to-earn resource.

Some players also position their Town Hall outside to allow easy destruction, giving opponents a quick victory while discouraging a full-scale attack on storages. This type of base is best for players who prioritize upgrading buildings and heroes over maintaining a high trophy count.

Trophy Base

A Trophy Pushing Base is designed to gain and maintain trophies by defending effectively against enemy attacks. The Town Hall is placed in the center to prevent easy destruction, making it harder for opponents to get two or three stars. The core of the base is heavily protected with strong defenses like Inferno Towers, X-Bows, and Eagle Artillery, ensuring that attackers struggle to reach the center. 

Traps are strategically placed to surprise enemies and disrupt their army, while high-damage splash defenses such as Wizard Towers and Bomb Towers cover critical areas to eliminate groups of troops quickly. This type of base is best for players who aim to climb to higher leagues, such as Titan or Legend League.

Hybrid Base (Mix of Farming & Trophy Base)

A Hybrid Base is designed to protect resources while maintaining trophies. The defenses and storage buildings are evenly distributed, ensuring that both trophies and resources are focused. 

The Town Hall is placed slightly off-center to confuse attackers and make it harder for them to plan a full destruction strategy. Defenses are spread across both the core and outer sections to provide solid protection against various attack strategies. This type of base is ideal for players who want to upgrade their village efficiently while keeping a stable trophy count.

War Base (For Clan Wars & CWL)

A War Base is specifically designed to prevent enemy attackers from getting 3 stars in Clan Wars and Clan War Leagues (CWL). The Town Hall is heavily guarded, making it difficult for opponents to destroy it early in the attack. Main defenses are spread out to minimize the impact of spells like Lightning, preventing attackers from easily taking down multiple important buildings at once.

Traps such as Giant Bombs and Seeking Air Mines are strategically placed. The base follows Anti-2-star or Anti-3-star designs, forcing attackers into challenging situations that make a full base destruction. This type of base is ideal for Clan War players who aim to win wars by minimizing enemy stars and ensuring stronger defenses against high-level opponents.

Anti-3-Star Base (For High-Level Wars)

An Anti-3-Star Base is built to stop attackers from getting a 3-stars in the attack. It is a best choice for Clan War Leagues (CWL) and high-level wars. It uses hidden traps like Giant Bombs, Seeking Air Mines, and Tornado Traps in unpredictable spots to cause damage to the army of the attackers. The base is divided into multiple compartments to slow down ground troops like P.E.K.K.A, Hog Riders, and Bowlers, forcing them to break through walls repeatedly.

The Town Hall is positioned strategically to make it harder for Electro Dragons, Queen Charge, or Siege Machines to reach it without heavy losses. This base is perfect for defending against powerful armies in high-level wars, where skilled attackers try to take down maxed-out defenses.

Anti-2-Star Base (For Protecting Trophies)

An Anti-2-Star Base is designed to make it extremely difficult for attackers to get 50% destruction and take down the Town Hall, making it perfect for players pushing trophies in high leagues like Titan and Legend League. The Town Hall is placed deep inside the base, far from easy access, forcing attackers to fight through multiple layers of defenses. Key defensive buildings like Inferno Towers, Eagle Artillery, and Scattershots are concentrated in high-impact areas to deal maximum damage to enemy troops. 

The outer buildings are spread out to waste enemy troop deployment time and prevent easy funneling. This type of base is ideal for players who want to maintain or climb in trophy rankings without constantly losing trophies to strong attackers.

They include strategic placements of buildings and defenses and spread-out defensive structures to counter common war strategies like Lavaloon, Bowler Walk, and Hog Riders.

Some farming bases also have the Town Hall outside, allowing attackers to take an easy 1-star while leaving storages mostly untouched.

TH10 Hybrid Bases: A mix between farming and trophy pushing, these bases offer balanced protection for both resources and trophies. They focus on protecting loot while keeping the Town Hall safe. These are ideal bases for players who want to maintain trophies without sacrificing resource collection.

Builder Hall Bases

Builder Hall bases are important for versus battles, where defense matters as much as attack. Unlike the Home Village, defenses activate immediately when troops are deployed. A good base uses Crusher, Multi Mortar, and Roaster to stop ground troops, while Air Bombs and Firecrackers handle air attacks. Traps and dead zones help control troop movement and make attacks less effective.

How to design effective layout

Designing a strong Town Hall base is important for defending resources, pushing trophies, or winning Clan Wars. A well-structured base can make it harder for attackers to get stars and loot. Here are key strategies for building an effective layout:

  1. Town Hall Placement: Decide if you want a farming, war, hybrid, or trophy base. Place the Town Hall in the center for war or trophy pushing, or keep it outside if farming and protecting resources.
  2. Defensive Structure Positioning: Place Inferno Towers, X-Bows, Eagle Artillery, and Scattershots in key areas to cover the core and high-value buildings. Avoid clustering defenses to prevent Lightning or Earthquake spell damage.
  3. Walls and Compartments: Use multiple compartments to slow down attackers. Compartmentalized bases make it harder for Hog Riders, Bowlers, or Electro Dragons to reach the core.
  4. Trap Placement: Use Giant Bombs, Seeking Air Mines, Tornado Traps, and Spring Traps near high-traffic areas where enemy troops are likely to move. This helps disrupt attacks.
  5. Splash Defenses: Place Wizard Towers and Bomb Towers near storages or high-value areas to counter swarm attacks like Minions or Witches.

Funneling & Pathing: Design the base so enemy troops don’t go directly to the core. Use dead zones, open gaps, and trap funnels to mislead troops and force them into kill zones.

An effective base should match your strategy. whether it’s protecting loot, trophies, or winning wars. If you want a quick setup, copying tested Town Hall base links is the easiest way to get a solid defense.
